result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 3, 2015.

The jail sentence may be served with huber.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Letter to defendant re; payment plan
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record. Victim rights have been complied.   Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders Count 1 - 8 months county jail with huber; court costs; DNA sample and DNA surcharge.  Count 2 - $100.00 fine plus court costs.   Sentence credit of 109 days.  Case Nos. 15CF10, 14CM76 and 14CF81 are dismissed and read in.  The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 3, 2015.  - rt

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. instead of the status conference.  - rt

records.addlTxt: Status conference at 03-03-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Ruiz indicates that he wants an attorney.  Court finds that there is good reason to waive the time limits for a preliminary hearing.   Court orders time limits for a preliminary hearing waived.   Mr. Ruiz was given a Petition and Order for Appointment of Counsel.  He is to immediately fill it out and return to the court.  - rt

Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tlusty calls case. Court advised DE of charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Referred to SPD. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of DE. Pretrial conference scheduled for 2-05-15 at 3:30 p.m. State requested current bond to continue. So ordered by the Court. ap
Bail/bond hearing on February 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Ruiz appeared in custody, in person.  Defendant was appearing for a bond hearing a new charge.  The court ordered at that hearing that the Clerk was to begin bond revocation proceedings in this case.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel L. Ruiz appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 cash bond; booking and do not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court ordered that the clerk begin bond forfeiture proceedings on current pending cases.  Notice of right to an attorney given to Mr. Ruiz.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 1:00 pm  - rt
